texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: When connecting to your server's POP3 service, your client might provide this error just after authentication:
texts.text: When connecting to your server's POP3 service, your client might provide this error just after authentication:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: The connection to the server was interrupted.
texts.text: The connection to the server was interrupted.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Your best bet is to check the mail log and see exactly what the problem is:
texts.text: Your best bet is to check the mail log and see exactly what the problem is:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
web pop3-login: Login: john [192.168.0.5]
pop3(john): Invalid mbox file /var/spool/mail/john: No such file or directory
pop3(john): Failed to create storage with data: mbox:/var/spool/mail/john
dovecot: child 29864 (pop3) returned error 89
texts.text:
web pop3-login: Login: john [192.168.0.5]
pop3(john): Invalid mbox file /var/spool/mail/john: No such file or directory
pop3(john): Failed to create storage with data: mbox:/var/spool/mail/john
dovecot: child 29864 (pop3) returned error 89

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In this case, the mbox file has become corrupt (possible from malformed 'From' headers). You have the option of repairing the issues within the file, or you can simply create a new mail spool for the user.
texts.text: In this case, the mbox file has become corrupt (possible from malformed 'From' headers). You have the option of repairing the issues within the file, or you can simply create a new mail spool for the user.
